title: 20 Summer Nail Designs to Inspire Your Next Vacation
description: Spoiler alert: Glazed donut nails are here to stay.
excerpt: Extra cherries on my nails, please!
text: 1Under the SeaWhen you think of summer, the first image that comes to mind is the beach. Well, why not always have a little piece of the beach with you? This manicure features a starfish, sandy accents, and ocean blue hues that feel like a mini getaway.2Floral AppliquésIf you find it difficult to move away from natural nail colors, a good way to add a bit of intrigue is with 3D appliqués. Use a neutral base color and colorful florals to draw some extra attention to your nails.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below3Everything All At OnceWalking into a nail salon and trying to decide what color or design to get for your manicure can be overwhelming. With so many options, it’s hard to choose just one. But what if you didn’t have to? This manicure is proof that combining all of the hottest nail trends into one manicure can create a masterpiece. It has a mix of all of the designs we know and love, from French tips and chrome lines to patterns and stripes.4Strawberry GirlIt’s official: Another summer has come, and the strawberry girl trend continues to evolve. This simple and chic interpretation of strawberry nails takes a classic natural nail color to the next level. Small 3D red berries add a pop of color, while the other nails are designed to mimic the texture of the fruit with gold specs for an extra sparkle.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below5Shapes and TexturesIf you consider yourself a bit of a maximalist, then this manicure is perfect for you. The 3D stripes and polka dots bring this intricate color block manicure to life for a unique and playful look for the summer.6AquamarineThis manicure is exactly what I imagine a mermaid’s nails would look like, and that is reason enough to add it to your mood board. The shimmering aqua shade resembles the glimmer of clear water washing up on the shore of a tropical beach. Advertisement - Continue Reading Below7Leopard FrenchPrints are having a major moment this summer, and leopard print, in particular, is at the top of everyone’s list. From clothing to accessories and now to your manicure, this leopard print French manicure is a great way to dress up your French tips and try out a new style.8Marshmallow ManiA simple all-white manicure is a go-to color for the summertime. An easy way to jazz up this classic style is to add a bit of texture with builder gel, and finishing with another coat of polish. This mani demonstrates how you can keep the simplicity of the neutral tone, but your nails will be far from boring.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below9Chrome French NailsGlazed nails have been one of the most popular nail trends for the past few seasons. This summer, the trend is evolving. Instead of using a solid color as the base of your chrome, opt for a colorful French design and follow up with a shimmery chrome to complete the manicure.10Hibiscus Flowers and Black French TipsIf you can’t seem to escape the hold of dark nail polish, we’re happy to tell you that there are many ways to incorporate darker shades into your summer manicures. This manicure uses colorful tropical flowers to brighten up a black French manicure. Advertisement - Continue Reading Below11Vacation VibesThis manicure captures the essence of the summer season with vibrant shades of yellow and orange and hints of a calming blue shade airbrushed onto a neutral base. Topped with golden accents and water droplet designs, this is the manicure you need to prep for your vacation.12Poolside NailsOnce the weather permits, the first place I hope to be is by a pool. Laying out poolside all day is a prime summer experience, and as much as we wish it could last forever, it can’t. But luckily, with a manicure like this, you can take the poolside vibe with you wherever you go. Use an iridescent blue shade with a matte top coat, then use clear builder gel to get a raindrop design.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below13Pastel PrintsEven though many may think that pastel tones are reserved for the spring, adding some lighter shades to your nails can help create a bit of depth when layered on top of deeper, contrasting colors.14Sunshine Aura NailsDon’t hurt your eyes trying to catch a glimpse of the summer sun—just get your nails done instead. This yellow airbrush design utilizes the popular aura nail trend to bring a bit of sunshine to your next nail set.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below15Cherry On TopIf you are looking for something cute and sweet, this manicure delivers. The cherry girl trend has been floating around TikTok for a while now, depicting deep cherry red tones and sultry romantic vibes that carry you through the cooler months. But now that warm weather is upon us, the cherry trend has taken on a new form. Cherry designs add an adorable pop of color to any manicure. This baby blue shade is the perfect base for adding tiny red rhinestones and thin green lines to mimic the fruit.16Summer OrchidsIf you are looking for a unique way to add florals to your manicure, this orchid design is exactly what you should show your nail technician. This design gives you all of the floral feels without being too on the nose for a manicure you’ll want to keep forever.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below17Chrome LinesIt is clear that chrome is quickly becoming a staple for cool girl manicures. While the trend has gone through many phases over the years, this season, the best way to incorporate chrome is through simple accents like the 3D stripes that resemble metal bars. Try either a color blocking or gradient design as the base to make the manicure a bit more interesting.18Sunset Nails If you’re looking for a manicure to heat up your summer, this orange and yellow airbrushed design mimics the sun’s rays. Advertisement - Continue Reading Below19Simple FrenchBy now, I think we’ve reached the conclusion that French tips aren’t going anywhere any time soon. So why not have a bit of fun with them? Swapping out the classic white for vibrant colors is an easy way to update the style.203D Polka DotsAdding texture is a fool-proof way to make any manicure more exciting and intricate. The 3D dots are a simple design that instantly elevates your nails to the next level.
html:
1

Under the Sea

When you think of summer, the first image that comes to mind is the beach. Well, why not always have a little piece of the beach with you? This manicure features a starfish, sandy accents, and ocean blue hues that feel like a mini getaway.

2

Floral Appliqués

If you find it difficult to move away from natural nail colors, a good way to add a bit of intrigue is with 3D appliqués. Use a neutral base color and colorful florals to draw some extra attention to your nails.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

3

Everything All At Once

Walking into a nail salon and trying to decide what color or design to get for your manicure can be overwhelming. With so many options, it’s hard to choose just one. But what if you didn’t have to? This manicure is proof that combining all of the hottest nail trends into one manicure can create a masterpiece. It has a mix of all of the designs we know and love, from French tips and chrome lines to patterns and stripes.

4

Strawberry Girl

It’s official: Another summer has come, and the strawberry girl trend continues to evolve. This simple and chic interpretation of strawberry nails takes a classic natural nail color to the next level. Small 3D red berries add a pop of color, while the other nails are designed to mimic the texture of the fruit with gold specs for an extra sparkle.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

5

Shapes and Textures

If you consider yourself a bit of a maximalist, then this manicure is perfect for you. The 3D stripes and polka dots bring this intricate color block manicure to life for a unique and playful look for the summer.

6

Aquamarine

This manicure is exactly what I imagine a mermaid’s nails would look like, and that is reason enough to add it to your mood board. The shimmering aqua shade resembles the glimmer of clear water washing up on the shore of a tropical beach.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

7

Leopard French

Prints are having a major moment this summer, and leopard print, in particular, is at the top of everyone’s list. From clothing to accessories and now to your manicure, this leopard print French manicure is a great way to dress up your French tips and try out a new style.

8

Marshmallow Mani

A simple all-white manicure is a go-to color for the summertime. An easy way to jazz up this classic style is to add a bit of texture with builder gel, and finishing with another coat of polish. This mani demonstrates how you can keep the simplicity of the neutral tone, but your nails will be far from boring.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

9

Chrome French Nails

Glazed nails have been one of the most popular nail trends for the past few seasons. This summer, the trend is evolving. Instead of using a solid color as the base of your chrome, opt for a colorful French design and follow up with a shimmery chrome to complete the manicure.

10

Hibiscus Flowers and Black French Tips

If you can’t seem to escape the hold of dark nail polish, we’re happy to tell you that there are many ways to incorporate darker shades into your summer manicures. This manicure uses colorful tropical flowers to brighten up a black French manicure.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

11

Vacation Vibes

This manicure captures the essence of the summer season with vibrant shades of yellow and orange and hints of a calming blue shade airbrushed onto a neutral base. Topped with golden accents and water droplet designs, this is the manicure you need to prep for your vacation.

12

Poolside Nails

Once the weather permits, the first place I hope to be is by a pool. Laying out poolside all day is a prime summer experience, and as much as we wish it could last forever, it can’t. But luckily, with a manicure like this, you can take the poolside vibe with you wherever you go. Use an iridescent blue shade with a matte top coat, then use clear builder gel to get a raindrop design.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

13

Pastel Prints

Even though many may think that pastel tones are reserved for the spring, adding some lighter shades to your nails can help create a bit of depth when layered on top of deeper, contrasting colors.

14

Sunshine Aura Nails

Don’t hurt your eyes trying to catch a glimpse of the summer sun—just get your nails done instead. This yellow airbrush design utilizes the popular aura nail trend to bring a bit of sunshine to your next nail set.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

15

Cherry On Top

If you are looking for something cute and sweet, this manicure delivers. The cherry girl trend has been floating around TikTok for a while now, depicting deep cherry red tones and sultry romantic vibes that carry you through the cooler months. But now that warm weather is upon us, the cherry trend has taken on a new form. Cherry designs add an adorable pop of color to any manicure. This baby blue shade is the perfect base for adding tiny red rhinestones and thin green lines to mimic the fruit.

16

Summer Orchids

If you are looking for a unique way to add florals to your manicure, this orchid design is exactly what you should show your nail technician. This design gives you all of the floral feels without being too on the nose for a manicure you’ll want to keep forever.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

17

Chrome Lines

It is clear that chrome is quickly becoming a staple for cool girl manicures. While the trend has gone through many phases over the years, this season, the best way to incorporate chrome is through simple accents like the 3D stripes that resemble metal bars. Try either a color blocking or gradient design as the base to make the manicure a bit more interesting.

18

Sunset Nails

If you’re looking for a manicure to heat up your summer, this orange and yellow airbrushed design mimics the sun’s rays.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

19

Simple French

By now, I think we’ve reached the conclusion that French tips aren’t going anywhere any time soon. So why not have a bit of fun with them? Swapping out the classic white for vibrant colors is an easy way to update the style.

20

3D Polka Dots

Adding texture is a fool-proof way to make any manicure more exciting and intricate. The 3D dots are a simple design that instantly elevates your nails to the next level.
